byline.contributor: Alison Smale and Melissa Eddy contributed reporting.

abstract: Helmut Schmidt, former chancellor of Federal Republic of Germany and staunch Social Democrat who aggressively pushed Germany toward international role during 1970s Cold War, dies at age 96; had pressured West Germany to form closer ties with Communist regime in East Germany while retaining high approval rates.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Schmidt, elected in 1974, often appeared to disregard diplomacy, but he pushed his country into a forceful international role during the waning Cold War years.

headline.main: Helmut Schmidt, Assertive West German Chancellor, Dies at 96
headline.print_headline: Helmut Schmidt, Assertive West German Chancellor, Dies at 96

snippet: Mr. Schmidt, elected in 1974, often appeared to disregard diplomacy, but he pushed his country into a forceful international role during the waning Cold War years.
